title: [GAMEPLAY] Azir ult passes through enemy

embed.description: Shurima shuffle into Azir ult procs the shield but fails to knock up the enemy. Looks like it was in range and just passed through the enemy champion.

body:
In the body of the post, include a more in-depth description of the bug you are encountering.

{{champion:268}} Azir ults into the enemy lux and manages to get in range for the shield on the E, but the Ultimate passes right through even though I'm fairly confident it was also in range.

Follow up the description of the bug with numbered step-by-step instructions on how to reproduce the issue.

{{champion:268}} I haven't done any testing to verify this, but I would guess it's probably cause by these steps:

1. Azir summons soldier (W) and shurima shuffles towards the enemy (E, then Q)
2. While in the Shurima shuffle, enemy roots Azir at a distance far enough away that the ult would miss.
3. Since Azir is already dashing he will continue forward towards the enemy as shown in the video.
4. Azir uses (R) and it passes through the enemy (presumably being treated as though it was used at the location where Azir was rooted.

Include how frequently you can get the issue to occur and any video or screenshots of the bug that might help clarify it.

{{champion:268}} This is the first time I have noticed the glitch, it might have happened previously but I probably just assumed I was bad.

replies.body: Looks like you just missed it. The trigger zone is around the soldier's shield, not around the entire soldier. :\
